channel.title: Bloomberg Technology
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Judge Weighs Big Changes to Google, Including Breakup, AI Limits
item.description: The federal judge who will decide how to limit Google’s monopoly in search is considering its advantage in artificial intelligence, and aiming to minimize harm to the other players in the market with any resolution.
item.dc:creator: Davey Alba, Josh Sisco

media:content.media:description: The Google search page.

item.title: AWS CEO Matt Garman Lays Out Amazon’s AI Plans | Bloomberg Technology 5/30/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow speaks with Amazon Web Services CEO Matt Garman about the company’s AI growth and its partners. Plus, sales of Apple’s iPhone are set to take a big hit from tariffs. And President Trump accuses China of violating an agreement with the US to ease tariffs. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Andreessen Horowitz in Deal Talks Valuing Abridge AI at $5.3 Billion
item.description: The startup is raising $300 million for software that takes notes on conversations with doctors and patients.
item.dc:creator: Kate Clark

media:content.media:description: Shiv Rao, co-founder and chief executive officer of Abridge AI Inc., during the Forbes Healthcare Summit in New York, US, on Tuesday, Dec. 5, 2023. The summit will cover topics including ChatGPT's capabilities, advanced technology to treat the whole person, recent breakthroughs in biopharma, and the role of human compassion and empathy in the system.

item.title: Why EA Canceled a New ‘Black Panther’ Video Game
item.description: The project from Cliffhanger Studios would have starred a group of heroes from the comic-book franchise
item.dc:creator: Jason Schreier

media:content.media:description: Electronic Arts headquarters in Redwood City, California, US, on Tuesday, July 18, 2023. Electronic Arts Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on August 1.

item.title: Deepfake Revenge Porn Is AI Generation’s Online Horror Story
item.dc:creator: Margi Murphy

media:content.media:description: US President Donald Trump speaks alongside US First Lady Melania Trump during a signing ceremony for S. 146, the Take It Down Act, in the Rose Garden of the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, May 19, 2025. Trump signed a bill to force social media companies to remove non-consensual sharing of explicit sexual imagery online, calling it a “horribly wrong” situation. Photographer: Samuel Corum/Bloomberg

item.title: TSMC Evaluates Building Advanced Chip Plant in the UAE
item.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. is evaluating building an advanced production facility in the United Arab Emirates and has discussed the possibility with officials in President Donald Trump’s administration, according to people familiar with the matter, a potentially major bet on the Middle East that would only come to fruition with Washington’s approval.
item.dc:creator: Mackenzie Hawkins, Jenny Leonard

media:content.media:description: The Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) logo displayed outside the company's Museum of Innovation in Hsinchu, Taiwan, on Tuesday, April 15, 2025. TSMC is scheduled to release earnings results on April 18.

item.title: Rivian Eyes New Debt Deal as Expected Vehicle Deliveries Slump
item.description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. is leading a potential high-yield bond sale for electronic vehicle manufacturer Rivian Automotive Inc., partly to refinance its upcoming debt, according to people familiar with the transaction.
item.dc:creator: Jill R Shah, Aaron Weinman, Rachel Graf

media:content.media:description: A Rivian R1T electric vehicle (EV) pickup truck, left, and R1S electric sports utility vehicle (SUV) at the company's showroom in New York, US, on Tuesday, Jan. 2, 2024. Rivian Automotive Inc. missed expectations for quarterly electric vehicle deliveries, weighing on the manufacturer's shares even as production ramped up during the past year.

item.title: Amazon Pledges to Continue Aggressive Data Center Expansion
item.description: Amazon.com Inc.’s cloud services chief says the company is aggressively expanding server farms globally and looking to boost access to the latest artificial intelligence chips from Nvidia Corp.
item.dc:creator: Matt Day, Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: An Amazon Web Services data center in Stone Ridge, Virginia, US, on Sunday, July 28, 2024. Data center developers in Northern Virginia are asking utility Dominion Energy Inc. for as much power as several nuclear reactors can generate, in the latest sign of how artificial intelligence is helping drive up electricity demand.

item.title: US Plans Wider China Tech Sanctions With Subsidiary Crackdown
item.description: The Trump administration plans to broaden restrictions on China’s tech sector with new regulations to capture subsidiaries of companies under US curbs.
item.dc:creator: Mackenzie Hawkins, Jenny Leonard

media:content.media:description: A wafer on display at the Semicon China expo in Shanghai, China, on Wednesday, March 20, 2024. The expo runs through March 22.

item.title: Microsoft Reaches an Agreement for First US Union Contract
item.description: Microsoft Corp. and the Communications Workers of America reached a tentative labor agreement covering around 300 quality-assurance staff at the company’s ZeniMax video-game subsidiary, the union said Friday.
item.dc:creator: Josh Eidelson

media:content.media:description: ZeniMax offices in Cockeysville, Maryland.

item.title: Eutelsat in Talks to Raise €1.5 Billion, Double French Stake
item.description: Eutelsat Communications SA, the European satellite operator working to rival Elon Musk’s Starlink, is in talks with investors to raise €1.5 billion ($1.7 billion) in a deal that would more than double the French government’s stake to 30%, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Jillian Deutsch, Kiel Porter

media:content.media:description: Satellites at the Eutelsat headquarters in Canial, Portugal.

item.title: Roblox’s Hit Farm Game Spurs Underground Digital Fruit Economy
item.description: Roblox Corp.’s 2-month-old Grow a Garden video game has quickly become one of the most-played titles in its history — and spawned a market for virtual crops and livestock that appears to violate company rules.
item.dc:creator: Cecilia D'Anastasio

media:content.media:description: Roblox Grow a Garden

item.title: NetEase Shares Near Record High as China’s Gen Z Embraces Games
item.description: NetEase Inc. shares are closing in on their first new all-time high in over four years, as a wave of youthful consumerism adds to a host of positives for China’s game stocks.
item.dc:creator: Henry Ren, Sangmi Cha

item.title: EchoStar Skips Bond Payment as FCC’s 5G Probe Heats Up
item.description: EchoStar Corp., the wireless and pay-TV operator controlled by billionaire Charlie Ergen, skipped an interest payment due Friday because of uncertainty about a regulatory probe.
item.dc:creator: Dorothy Ma, Molly Schuetz

media:content.media:description: EchoStar Corporation headquarters in Englewood, Colorado.

item.title: China’s Startups Race to Dominate the Coming AI Robot Boom
item.description: Elon Musk worries the country will eventually lead in the field of humanoids

media:content.media:description: Workers operate to assemble ENGINEAI PM01 humanoid robots at the company’s workshop in Shenzhen, China on Tuesday, 20 May 2025. Photographer: Qilai Shen/

item.title: Apple’s Reliance on China Is About Far More Than Labor Costs
item.description: A new book argues that the company’s approach to outsourcing is a formidable competitive advantage that would be difficult to unravel.
item.dc:creator: Drake Bennett

media:content.media:description: An advertisement for the Apple Inc. iPhone 16 Pro smartphone at a subway station in Shanghai, China, on Monday, April 14, 2025. President Donald Trump pledged he will still apply tariffs to phones, computers and popular consumer electronics, downplaying a weekend exemption as a procedural step in his overall push to remake US trade.

item.title: Nvidia Lays Out Worst-Case Scenario in Bid to Open China Market
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ian King reports on Nvidia’s increasing public campaign to persuade the Trump administration to ease restrictions on the export of advanced chips to China.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang, co-founder and chief executive officer of Nvidia Corp., speaks while holding the company's new GeForce RTX 50 series graphics cards and a Thor Blackwell robotics processor during the 2025 CES event in Las Vegas, Nevada, US, on Monday, Jan. 6, 2025. Huang announced a raft of new chips, software and services, aiming to stay at the forefront of artificial intelligence computing.

item.title: Smartphone Sales Growth Hit by Tariff ‘Whirlwind of Uncertainty’
item.description: Sales of Apple Inc.’s iPhone and its closest rivals are expected to take a significant blow from the Trump administration’s new tariff policy unveiled in April.
item.dc:creator: Vlad Savov

media:content.media:description: IPhone 15 smartphones at an Apple store in the Brooklyn borough of New York, US, on Friday, May 23, 2025. President Donald Trump threatened Apple Inc. with a tariff of at least 25% if it does not manufacture its iPhones in the US, ramping up pressure on the tech giant to secure more domestic production.

item.title: TikTok Shop Cutting More Indonesia Jobs After Taking Over Rival
item.description: ByteDance Ltd.’s e-commerce arm TikTok Shop is eliminating several hundred jobs in Indonesia in its latest round of cuts, slashing costs after taking over the operations of local rival Tokopedia last year.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Poh

media:content.media:description: TikTok Shop Photographer: Ezra Acayan/Getty Images AsiaPac

item.title: This $7,000 Single-Seat Electric Car Is a Big Hit in Japan
item.description: In the rural suburbs of Hiroshima, a Japanese startup is trying to kick start the nation’s electric vehicle market with the smallest, cheapest car it can possibly make.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Takahashi

media:content.media:description: KG Motors CEO Kazunari Kusunoki with the mibot.

item.title: Jump India Said to Hire Akhtar From IMC in Top Technology Role
item.description: Jump India, the local arm of global market maker Jump Trading, has hired Javed Akhtar to lead its technology division, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Savio Shetty

media:content.media:description: Fiber optic cables, center, and copper Ethernet cables feed into switches inside a communications room at an office in London, U.K., on Monday, May 21, 2018. The Department of Culture, Media and Sport will work with the Home Office to publish a white paper later this year setting out legislation, according to a statement, which will also seek to force tech giants to reveal how they target abusive and illegal online material posted by users. Photographer: Jason Alden/Bloomberg

item.title: A Musk-Telegram AI Pact Sets the Stage for More Drama
item.description: Conspiracy theories and extremism on Pavel Durov’s freewheeling app could be supercharged by a deep integration with AI chatbot Grok.
item.dc:creator: Parmy Olson

media:content.media:description: Sorting out the details.

item.title: Synopsys Suspends Guidance After US Notice on Export Curbs
item.description: Synopsys Inc., a top maker of chip-design software, suspended its financial guidance for the current quarter and fiscal year after receiving word from the US government about new restrictions on exports to China.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Synopsys headquarters in Mountain View, California.

item.title: NTT Docomo to Buy SBI’s Online Bank for $2.9 Billion
item.description: NTT Docomo Inc. is buying SBI Holdings Inc.’s online bank in a ¥420 billion ($2.9 billion) deal to shore up the Japanese mobile carrier’s financial offerings in a hyper-competitive market.
item.dc:creator: Kazu Hirano, Yuki Furukawa

media:content.media:description: An NTT Docomo Inc. store in Tokyo. Photographer: Kiyoshi Ota/Bloomberg

item.title: Dell Annual Profit Outlook Tops Estimates on AI Server Boost
item.description: Dell Technologies Inc. gave a profit outlook for the year that exceeded estimates and said it had seen a significant increase in orders for servers to run AI networks.
item.dc:creator: Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: Dell Technologies headquarters in Round Rock, Texas.

item.title: Nvidia Shrugs Off China Concerns With Upbeat Forecast | Bloomberg Technology 5/29/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Nvidia surpassing Microsoft as the most valuable company, after investors shrugged off concerns about China-related curbs. Plus, Informatica’s CEO explains what is driving Salesforce's $8 billion acquisition of the company. And Tesla targets June 12 to launch its robotaxi service in Austin, as Elon Musk steps back from his government role. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Microsoft Touts AI Sales at Town Hall, Reveals Barclays Contract
item.description: Microsoft Corp. touted its progress selling artificial intelligence tools to corporate customers during a companywide town hall on Thursday, including a major deal with Barclays Plc.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: A customer uses a computer with Microsoft Copilot+ PC in Union City, California.

item.title: OpenAI, Anthropic Prepare for a New Era of AI Products
item.description: Leading AI labs are now working to turn their technical advances into compelling apps and hardware devices. But first...
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Sam Altman, chief executive officer of OpenAI Inc., during a Senate Commerce, Science, and Transportation Committee hearing in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, May 8, 2025. The leaders of some of the biggest technology and artificial intelligence companies will go to Congress on Thursday with a wish list of sorts that at its top has doing away with regulation they say inhibits their firms’ growth and by default, sends business to China. Photographer: Nathan Howard/Bloomberg

item.title: Disney+ Expands Subscriber Perks, Including Movie Premieres
item.description: Hulu customers can also win TV show and concert tickets
item.dc:creator: Thomas Buckley

media:content.media:description: The Disney+ website on a smartphone in the Brooklyn borough of New York, US, on Monday, July 18, 2022. Walt Disney Co.'s ESPN will raise the price of its streaming service by 43% next month, betting that it can help cover the escalating cost of sports rights without losing subscribers who are grappling with soaring inflation. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: The Podcast About Podcasts That’s Becoming a Cult Podcast
item.description: Talking Talk is taking the burgeoning podcast industry seriously and finding a growing audience on Instagram
item.dc:creator: Ashley Carman

media:content.media:description: Roommates and childhood friends Peter Ditzler and Cam George host their Talking Talk podcast from their living room in Los Angeles
